com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor

Class JDBCAdaptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor.Adaptor
      • com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor.JDBCAdaptor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MySQLAdaptor, OracleAdaptor, PostgreSQLAdaptor, SQLiteAdaptor, SQLServerAdaptor, VerticaAdaptor

    public abstract class JDBCAdaptor
extends Adaptor
    Abstract subclass defining many methods and fields for JDBC functionality including the construction of SQL statements incorporating pagination, filtering, sorting, and total row counts.

    The code in this class is based on Oracle functionality. Other vendor JDBC Adaptor subclasses should extend this class and override it's methods, particalarly buildSelect(String, String, String, int, int, JSONObject) and buildSelectCount(String, JSONObject)

    Author:
    David Varon

        public String NULL_REPLACEMENT

    • Constructor Detail

      • JDBCAdaptor

        public JDBCAdaptor()
        Default constructor for adaptors, includes debug-level logging, but nothing else.

        public JDBCAdaptor(YADARequest yadaReq)
        Parameters:
        yadaReq - YADA request configuration
        Since:
        0.4.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(YADAQuery yq)
             throws YADAAdaptorExecutionException
        Executes the statemetns stored in the query object. Results are stored in a data structure inside a YADAQueryResult object contained by the query object.
        Overrides:
        execute in class Adaptor
        Parameters:
        yq - YADAQuery object containing code to be executed
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorExecutionException - when the adaptor can't execute the statement or statements stored in the query
        Since:
        0.4.0.0

      • buildCall

        public StringBuffer buildCall(String core)
        Wraps a function call in curly brackets
        Parameters:
        core - the SQL function call
        Returns:
        StringBuffer containing query text surrounded by curly braces

      • buildSelect

        public StringBuffer buildSelect(String core,
                       String sortKey,
                       String sortOrder,
                       int firstRow,
                       int pageSize,
                       org.json.JSONObject filters)
                         throws YADAAdaptorException
        Create a YADA SELECT statement from core wrapping it in two subqueries to account for pagination, sorting, and filtering with a where clause.
        Parameters:
        core - the code to wrap
        sortKey - the column on which to sort
        sortOrder - the sort order 'asc' or 'desc'
        firstRow - the lower limiter of the result set
        pageSize - the number of rows to return
        filters - a JSON object containing the WHERE criteria
        Returns:
        StringBuffer containing newly wrapped core sql, with pagination, filtering, and sorting, as desired
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorException - when the query filters can't be converted into a WHERE clause

      • buildSelectCount

        public StringBuffer buildSelectCount(String core,
                            org.json.JSONObject filters)
                              throws YADAAdaptorException
        Returns a StringBuffer with core sql + filters, wrapped in an outer sql COUNT(*) query. This is typically used in pagination scenarios to return the total number of records returnable by a query when only a subset are requested by the application.
        Parameters:
        core - the SQL to wrap in an outer count(*) query
        filters - a JSON object containing the WHERE criteria
        Returns:
        StringBuffer of wrapped core sql including filters
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorException - when the query filters can't be converted into a WHERE clause

      • getQueryFilters

        protected String getQueryFilters(boolean append)
                          throws YADAAdaptorException
        Calls getQueryFilters(boolean, StringBuffer, JSONObject) with append = false as well as a null StringBuffer and filters from Adaptor.yadaReq
        Parameters:
        append - currently ignored, always reset to false
        Returns:
        an SQL representation of the json filter string
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorException - when the query filters can't be converted into a WHERE clause

      • getQueryFilters

        protected String getQueryFilters(boolean append,
                     StringBuffer sql,
                     org.json.JSONObject filters)
                          throws YADAAdaptorException
        Converts the filters stored in the local Adaptor.yadaReq config as json into an SQL fragment for appendage to a WHERE clause
        Parameters:
        append - currently ignored
        sql - the current SQL query to which to append the WHERE clause
        filters - a JSON object containing the WHERE criteria
        Returns:
        String SQL translation of JSONObject.toString() filters
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorException - when the filters cannot be converted into a WHERE clause
        Since:
        0.4.0.0

      • setQueryParameter

        protected void setQueryParameter(PreparedStatement pstmt,
                     int index,
                     char type,
                     String val)
                          throws YADASQLException
        Sets the parameter value based on the data type designated in the YADA Markup, mapped to the correct JDBC setter.
        Parameters:
        pstmt - the statement in which to set the parameter values
        index - the current parameter
        type - the data type of the parameter
        val - the value to set
        Throws:
        YADASQLException - when a parameter cannot be set, for instance if the data type is wrong or unsupported

      • setTimestampParameter

        protected void setTimestampParameter(PreparedStatement pstmt,
                         int index,
                         char type,
                         String val)
                              throws SQLException
        Sets a ?t parameter value mapped to the correct Types.TIMESTAMP JDBC setter.
        Parameters:
        pstmt - the statement in which to set the parameter values
        index - the current parameter
        type - the data type of the parameter (retained here for logging)
        val - the value to set
        Throws:
        SQLException - when a parameter cannot be set, for instance if the data type is wrong or unsupported
        Since:
        0.5.1.0

                    String val)
